nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: Discrimination means—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: direct or indirect discrimination on the basis of an attribute; or

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: a contravention of section 17, 19, 20, 22, 32, 33, 40, 45, 54, 55 or 56.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: Discrimination on the basis of an attribute includes discrimination on the basis—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: that a person has that attribute or had it at any time, whether or not he or she had it at the time of the discrimination;

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: of a characteristic that a person with that attribute generally has;

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: of a characteristic that is generally imputed to a person with that attribute;

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: that a person is presumed to have that attribute or to have had it at any time.

nodes.label: Subsection 3
nodes.summary: For the purposes of subsection (2), if a person with a disability is accompanied by or possesses an assistance aid, being accompanied by or the possession of that assistance aid is taken to be a chara...

nodes.label: Subsection 4
nodes.summary: In subsection (3)— Equal Opportunity Act 2010 No. 16 of 2010 21 assistance aid means any of the following that alleviates the effects of a person's disability—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: equipment (including a palliative or therapeutic device);

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: a person who provides assistance or services to a person with a disability; Examples 1 an interpreter; 2 a reader.

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: an assistance dog.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: Indirect discrimination occurs if a person imposes, or proposes to impose, a requirement, condition or practice—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: that has, or is likely to have, the effect of disadvantaging persons with an attribute; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: that is not reasonable.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: The person who imposes, or proposes to impose, the requirement, condition or practice has the burden of proving that the requirement, condition or practice is reasonable.

nodes.label: Subsection 3
nodes.summary: Whether a requirement, condition or practice is reasonable depends on all the relevant circumstances of the case, including the following—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the nature and extent of the disadvantage resulting from the imposition, or proposed imposition, of the requirement, condition or practice;

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: whether the disadvantage is proportionate to the result sought by the person who imposes, or proposes to impose, the requirement, condition or practice;

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: the cost of any alternative requirement, condition or practice;

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: the financial circumstances of the person imposing, or proposing to impose, the requirement, condition or practice;

nodes.label: Paragraph e
nodes.summary: whether reasonable adjustments or reasonable accommodation could be made to the requirement, condition or practice to reduce the disadvantage caused, including the availability of an alternative requi...

nodes.label: Subsection 4

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: This Act does not prohibit discrimination to which a Division of Part 4 applies if—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: an exception in that Division applies; or

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the conduct constituting discrimination under that Division also constitutes discrimination under another Division of Part 4 and an exception in the other Division applies; or

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: a general exception under Part 5 applies; or

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: an exemption under Part 5 applies. Example A football club refuses to register a 15-year-old girl to participate in a football competition that is restricted to boys only.  Section 72 contains an exce...

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: An exception or an exemption referred to in subsection (1) is a defence to discrimination, and the person seeking to rely on the exception or exemption has the burden of proving that it applies.

nodes.summary:
The purpose of this Part is to provide for the 
taking of positive action to eliminate 
discrimination, sexual harassment and 
victimisation.
